text:
I just made a thing for Mastodon users. I’d love if it were found helpful or if anyone had a suggestion for low-hanging improvements!
<https://twitter.com/refactorordie/status/1594047958613360640>

elements.text: I just made a thing for Mastodon users. I’d love if it were found helpful or if anyone had a suggestion for low-hanging improvements!

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/refactorordie|@refactorordie>: I just made <https://tooot.to>, a #Mastodon social linker, to make it easier to link people to follow in a couple clicks.
No more copy-name, open/find tab, paste, search :sweat_smile:

Here are some example links: 
* <https://tooot.to/@odbol@vis.social>
* <https://tooot.to/@nova@hachyderm.io>

Feedback welcome!
attachments.text:
I just made <https://tooot.to>, a #Mastodon social linker, to make it easier to link people to follow in a couple clicks.
No more copy-name, open/find tab, paste, search :sweat_smile:

Here are some example links: 
* <https://tooot.to/@odbol@vis.social>
* <https://tooot.to/@nova@hachyderm.io>

Feedback welcome!

text: Oh I see. It took me a second to understand what it does. Nice!

elements.text: Oh I see. It took me a second to understand what it does. Nice!

text:
Looks promising... but it creates the inverse problem: I need to type my instance's URL, unless it's in the predefined list, which is already a bit too long for my taste.
I don't know if this can be avoided. I am always logged in into my instance, so maybe this leaves an exploitable trace in my browser? Though I'd almost prefer that it doesn't (for privacy reasons).
